Top Definition. leadership. Leadership is great men and women with certain preferred traits influencing followers to do what the leaders wish in order to achieve group/organizational goals that reflect excellence defined as some kind of higher level effectiveness. - Joseph Rost

leadership. n. 1. the position or function of a leader. 2. the period during which a person occupies the position of leader: during her leadership very little was achieved. 3. leadership-the status of a leader; they challenged his leadership of the union. status, position-the relative position or standing of things or especially persons in a society; he had the status of a minor; the novel attained the status of a classic; atheists do not enjoy a favorable position in American life.
